justification: The paper repeatedly refers to the "Race IAT" as the task researchers use when they wish to capture automatic pro-White / anti-Black evaluations (e.g., “In the Race IAT, the visual features of an image might favor a ‘White’ or ‘Black’ response… Participants’ biases are quantified with the Race IAT”).

For the reliability study the authors "re-assessed the test-retest reliability of Race and introversion-extraversion IATs administered twice," indicating that an Introversion-Extraversion IAT is the instrument used to measure that self-concept.

In the predictive-validity analyses the authors state they included the “Sexuality IAT” to assess attitudes toward “Gay people vs. Straight people,” making the Sexuality IAT the measure of implicit sexuality attitudes.

Discussing prior Quad-model work, the article notes that “the Quad model illustrated that performance on the Young-Old IAT differs by gender, race, and motivation to control prejudice,” treating the Young-Old IAT as the measure of implicit age bias.

measured_by: Internal Motivation to Respond without Prejudice scale
justification: The authors describe using “The Internal Motivation to Respond without Prejudice scale… the five-item internal motivation subscale” as the instrument to capture participants’ internal motivation.
construct: internal motivation to respond without prejudice

justification: For criterion variables the paper uses “the race … prior interpersonal contact measures… five items adapted from commonly used items,” indicating this scale operationalises prior contact with racial out-groups.

Analogously, the authors mention “the sexuality prior interpersonal contact measures each include five items… and are especially relevant because it is the available criterion measure,” showing this scale measures prior contact with sexual-orientation out-groups.
construct: prior contact with gay and lesbian people
